title: Tide turns against plastic ocean pollution | ShareAmerica
body: Reversing ocean plastic pollution is an urgent need. Fortunately, the tide may be turning. "The momentum to combat plastic waste in the marine environment is stronger than ever," said U.S. Under Secretary of State Catherine Novelli in 2015. The United States has strong domestic programs to reduce the amount of waste making its way to the sea.
readable_content:
ShareAmerica - (2016-09-06): Doug Woodring, a passionate ocean lover, established Ocean Recovery Alliance to combat plastic pollution in the ocean. Millions of tons of plastic debris annually end up in the ocean, posing a threat to marine life and human health. The article highlights efforts to combat this issue by individuals and organizations, as well as governments and companies. It also provides practical tips on reducing plastic pollution.

ShareAmerica - (2016-09-06): Governments, companies, and individuals can contribute to reducing plastic pollution. Examples include developing new materials, recycling ocean plastics into products, and using technology for mapping and reporting trash found along waterways. The article emphasizes the importance of preventing plastic pollution and provides practical tips for individuals to make a difference.
summary:
